CompositeDisposable.name: CompositeDisposable

instanceMethods.name: constructor
instanceMethods.summary: Construct an instance, optionally with one or more disposables
instanceMethods.description: Construct an instance, optionally with one or more disposables

instanceMethods.name: dispose
instanceMethods.summary: Dispose all disposables added to this composite disposable.
instanceMethods.description:
Dispose all disposables added to this composite disposable.

If this object has already been disposed, this method has no effect.

instanceMethods.name: add
instanceMethods.summary: Add disposables to be disposed when the composite is disposed.
instanceMethods.description:
Add disposables to be disposed when the composite is disposed.

If this object has already been disposed, this method has no effect.

arguments.name: ...disposables
arguments.description: {Disposable} instances or any objects with `.dispose()` methods.

arguments.name: disposable
arguments.description: {Disposable} instance or any object with a `.dispose()` method.

instanceMethods.name: clear
instanceMethods.summary:
Clear all disposables. They will not be disposed by the next call
to dispose.
instanceMethods.description:
Clear all disposables. They will not be disposed by the next call
to dispose.

CompositeDisposable.summary:
An object that aggregates multiple {Disposable} instances together
into a single disposable, so they can all be disposed as a group.
CompositeDisposable.description:
An object that aggregates multiple {Disposable} instances together
into a single disposable, so they can all be disposed as a group.

These are very useful when subscribing to multiple events.

Disposable.name: Disposable

classMethods.name: isDisposable
classMethods.summary:
Ensure that `object` correctly implements the `Disposable`
contract.
classMethods.description:
Ensure that `object` correctly implements the `Disposable`
contract.

arguments.name: object
arguments.description: An {Object} you want to perform the check against.

returnValues.description: Returns a {Boolean} indicating whether `object` is a valid `Disposable`.

arguments.name: disposalAction
arguments.description: A {Function} to call when {::dispose} is called for the first time.

instanceMethods.name: dispose
instanceMethods.summary:
Perform the disposal action, indicating that the resource associated
with this disposable is no longer needed.
instanceMethods.description:
Perform the disposal action, indicating that the resource associated
with this disposable is no longer needed.

You can call this method more than once, but the disposal action will only
be performed the first time.

Disposable.summary:
A handle to a resource that can be disposed. For example,
{Emitter::on} returns disposables representing subscriptions.
Disposable.description:
A handle to a resource that can be disposed. For example,
{Emitter::on} returns disposables representing subscriptions.

Emitter.name: Emitter

instanceMethods.name: on
instanceMethods.summary:
Register the given handler function to be invoked whenever events by
the given name are emitted via {::emit}.
instanceMethods.description:
Register the given handler function to be invoked whenever events by
the given name are emitted via {::emit}.

arguments.name: eventName
arguments.description: {String} naming the event that you want to invoke the handler when emitted.

arguments.name: handler
arguments.description: {Function} to invoke when {::emit} is called with the given event name.

returnValues.description: Returns a {Disposable} on which `.dispose()` can be called to unsubscribe.

instanceMethods.name: preempt
instanceMethods.summary:
Register the given handler function to be invoked *before* all
other handlers existing at the time of subscription whenever events by the
given name are emitted via {::emit}.
instanceMethods.description:
Register the given handler function to be invoked *before* all
other handlers existing at the time of subscription whenever events by the
given name are emitted via {::emit}.

Use this method when you need to be the first to handle a given event. This
could be required when a data structure in a parent object needs to be
updated before third-party event handlers registered on a child object via a
public API are invoked. Your handler could itself be preempted via
subsequent calls to this method, but this can be controlled by keeping
methods based on `::preempt` private.

arguments.name: eventName
arguments.description: {String} naming the event that you want to invoke the handler when emitted.

arguments.name: handler
arguments.description: {Function} to invoke when {::emit} is called with the given event name.

returnValues.description: Returns a {Disposable} on which `.dispose()` can be called to unsubscribe.

instanceMethods.name: emit
instanceMethods.summary: Invoke handlers registered via {::on} for the given event name.
instanceMethods.description: Invoke handlers registered via {::on} for the given event name.

arguments.name: eventName
arguments.description: The name of the event to emit. Handlers registered with {::on} for the same name will be invoked.

arguments.name: value
arguments.description: Callbacks will be invoked with this value as an argument.

Emitter.summary:
Utility class to be used when implementing event-based APIs that
allows for handlers registered via `::on` to be invoked with calls to
`::emit`. Instances of this class are intended to be used internally by
classes that expose an event-based API.
Emitter.description:
Utility class to be used when implementing event-based APIs that
allows for handlers registered via `::on` to be invoked with calls to
`::emit`. Instances of this class are intended to be used internally by
classes that expose an event-based API.

For example:

```coffee
class User
  constructor: ->
    @emitter = new Emitter

  onDidChangeName: (callback) ->
    @emitter.on 'did-change-name', callback

  setName: (name) ->
    if name isnt @name
      @name = name
      @emitter.emit 'did-change-name', name
    @name
```
